intro: Brachyglottis pentacopa, commonly known as the New Zealand flax or kōwhai, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its narrow, strap-like leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various native species. Due to its ornamental value, it is also cultivated in gardens outside of New Zealand.
